title: Fact Check: Truth behind Bandra railway station gathering accused Vinay Dubey’s father | Newsmobile
author: newsmobile.in
vclaim:
A picture of a self-proclaimed leader and activist, Vinay Dubey, is going viral shared on social media with a claim that his mother married a Muslim man named Mahmood (his father) and gave him a Hindu name so that he can mislead Hindus.

Dubey was arrested for allegedly disseminating ‘false rumours’ that led to a mass gathering at Bandra station.

NewsMobile fact-checked the above posts and found the claim to be FALSE.

NewsMobile went through Vinay Dubey’s social media account and came across a tweet where he has mentioned his father.

He retweeted a tweet by Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh. In the tweet, dated April 10, Deshmukh said that Jatashankar Dubey, an auto driver from Airoli in Mumbai had donated Rs 25,000 towards the Maharashtra CM’s coronavirus relief fund.

“I am proud of my dad. My father gave some money from the savings of his life to the Maharashtra government to fight against Corona,” Vinay wrote in his tweet.

On further investigation, we also found that Dubey contested the Lok Sabha polls 2019 from Kalyan as an independent candidate.

We found his affidavit on the website of Election commission, where his father’s name is Jatashankar Paramanand Dubey.

The above information proves that the claims made in the viral post are false.

If you want to fact-check any story, WhatsApp it now on +91 88268 00707
